publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-308# Mr Jamie Stone: Funding of Agricultural Business Improvement Scheme—That the Parliament notes that farmers in the Highlands have incurred expenses in drawing up applications to the Agricultural Business Improvement Scheme, recognises that the Executive have given an extra £1.2 million to the scheme but calls upon it, in the light of the Treasury’s surplus, to make representations to the Chancellor of the Exchequer to release extra funds to meet the deficit. Supported by: Mr Mike Rumbles*, Tavish Scott*, George Lyon*, Mr John Munro*
S1M-308# Funding of Agricultural Business Improvement Scheme (lodged on 19 November 1999) Alex Fergusson*

S1M-308# Mr Jamie Stone: Funding of Agricultural Business Improvement Scheme—That the Parliament notes that farmers in the Highlands have incurred expenses in drawing up applications to the Agricultural Business Improvement Scheme, recognises that the Executive have given an extra £1 million to the scheme but calls upon it, in the light of the Treasury’s surplus, to make representations to the Chancellor of the Exchequer to release extra funds to meet the deficit. Supported by: Mr Mike Rumbles, Tavish Scott, George Lyon, Mr John Munro, Alex Fergusson
S1M-308# Funding of Agricultural Business Improvement Scheme (lodged on 19 November 1999) Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-308# Funding of Agricultural Business Improvement Scheme (lodged on 19 November 1999) Mr Jamie McGrigor*

S1M-308# Mr Jamie Stone: Funding of Agricultural Business Improvement Scheme—That the Parliament notes that farmers in the Highlands have incurred expenses in drawing up applications to the Agricultural Business Improvement Scheme, recognises that the Executive have given an extra £1 million to the scheme but calls upon it, in the light of the Treasury’s surplus, to make representations to the Chancellor of the Exchequer to release extra funds to meet the deficit. Supported by: Mr Mike Rumbles, Tavish Scott, George Lyon, Mr John Munro, Alex Fergusson, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Jamie McGrigor
S1M-308# Funding of Agricultural Business Improvement Scheme (lodged on 19 November 1999) Mary Scanlon*, Mr David Davidson*

S1M-308# Mr Jamie Stone: Funding of Agricultural Business Improvement Scheme—That the Parliament notes that farmers in the Highlands have incurred expenses in drawing up applications to the Agricultural Business Improvement Scheme, recognises that the Executive have given an extra £1 million to the scheme but calls upon it, in the light of the Treasury’s surplus, to make representations to the Chancellor of the Exchequer to release extra funds to meet the deficit. Supported by: Mr Mike Rumbles, Tavish Scott, George Lyon, Mr John Munro, Alex Fergusson, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mary Scanlon, Mr David Davidson, Mr Brian Monteith
S1M-308# Funding of Agricultural Business Improvement Scheme (lodged on 19 November 1999) Fergus Ewing*
S1M-308# Funding of Agricultural Business Improvement Scheme (lodged on 19 November 1999) Donald Gorrie*

S1M-308# Mr Jamie Stone: Funding of Agricultural Business Improvement Scheme—That the Parliament notes that farmers in the Highlands have incurred expenses in drawing up applications to the Agricultural Business Improvement Scheme, recognises that the Executive have given an extra £1 million to the scheme but calls upon it, in the light of the Treasury’s surplus, to make representations to the Chancellor of the Exchequer to release extra funds to meet the deficit. Supported by: Mr Mike Rumbles, Tavish Scott, George Lyon, Mr John Munro, Alex Fergusson, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mary Scanlon, Mr David Davidson, Mr Brian Monteith, Fergus Ewing, Donald Gorrie
S1M-308# Funding of Agricultural Business Improvement Scheme (lodged on 19 November 1999) David Mundell*, Nick Johnston*

S1M-308# Mr Jamie Stone: Funding of Agricultural Business Improvement Scheme—That the Parliament notes that farmers in the Highlands have incurred expenses in drawing up applications to the Agricultural Business Improvement Scheme, recognises that the Executive have given an extra £1 million to the scheme but calls upon it, in the light of the Treasury’s surplus, to make representations to the Chancellor of the Exchequer to release extra funds to meet the deficit. Supported by: Mr Mike Rumbles, Tavish Scott, George Lyon, Mr John Munro, Alex Fergusson, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mary Scanlon, Mr David Davidson, Mr Brian Monteith, Fergus Ewing, Donald Gorrie, David Mundell, Nick Johnston

S1M-308# Mr Jamie Stone: Funding of Agricultural Business Improvement Scheme—That the Parliament notes that farmers in the Highlands have incurred expenses in drawing up applications to the Agricultural Business Improvement Scheme, recognises that the Executive have given an extra £1 million to the scheme but calls upon it, in the light of the Treasury’s surplus, to make representations to the Chancellor of the Exchequer to release extra funds to meet the deficit. Supported by: Mr Mike Rumbles, Tavish Scott, George Lyon, Mr John Munro, Alex Fergusson, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mary Scanlon, Mr David Davidson, Mr Brian Monteith, Fergus Ewing, Donald Gorrie, David Mundell, Nick Johnston, Robin Harper
